\sphinxAtStartPar
A high\sphinxhyphen{}performance graph embedding and influence maximization library powered by JAX, designed for scalable network analysis and research.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Installation Guide}
\label{\detokenize{installation:installation-guide}}\label{\detokenize{installation::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm supports Python 3.8+ and is available through multiple installation methods.


\section{PyPI Installation (Recommended)}
\label{\detokenize{installation:pypi-installation-recommended}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The easiest way to install GraphEm is via pip:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }graphem\PYGZhy{}jax
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This will install GraphEm with all required dependencies.


\section{Development Installation}
\label{\detokenize{installation:development-installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
For development or to get the latest features:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/sashakolpakov/graphem.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }graphem
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}e\PYG{+w}{ }.
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{GPU/TPU Support}
\label{\detokenize{installation:gpu-tpu-support}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm leverages JAX for acceleration. For GPU and TPU installation instructions, please refer to the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/google/jax\#installation}{official JAX installation guide}.


\section{Dependencies}
\label{\detokenize{installation:dependencies}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm automatically installs all required dependencies:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
JAX \& JAXLib (≥0.3.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Core computation backend

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
NumPy (≥1.21.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Array operations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
NetworkX (≥2.6.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Graph algorithms

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Plotly (≥5.5.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Interactive visualization

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
SciPy (≥1.7.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Scientific computing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
NDlib (≥5.1.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Network diffusion models

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Pandas (≥1.3.0) \sphinxhyphen{} Data structures

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
And others for logging, profiling, and utilities

\end{itemize}


\section{Documentation Dependencies}
\label{\detokenize{installation:documentation-dependencies}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To build documentation locally:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}graphem\PYGZhy{}jax[docs]\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }docs
make\PYG{+w}{ }html
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{System Requirements}
\label{\detokenize{installation:system-requirements}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Minimum Requirements:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python 3.8+

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
4GB RAM

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Modern CPU with AVX support

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Recommended for Large Graphs:}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python 3.9+

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
16GB+ RAM

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
NVIDIA GPU with CUDA support

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
SSD storage for large datasets

\end{itemize}


\section{Verification}
\label{\detokenize{installation:verification}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Test your installation:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{graphem}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{ge}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generate a small test graph}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{erdos\PYGZus{}renyi\PYGZus{}graph}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{GraphEm installation successful!}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Troubleshooting}
\label{\detokenize{installation:troubleshooting}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{JAX Installation Issues}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If you encounter JAX installation problems:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure you have a compatible Python version (3.8\sphinxhyphen{}3.11)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Update pip: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip install \sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}upgrade pip}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Try installing JAX separately first: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip install jax jaxlib}}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Memory Issues}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For large graphs, consider:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reducing \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{batch\_size}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sample\_size}} parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Using smaller embedding dimensions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Processing graphs in chunks

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Import Errors}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If you see import errors:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reinstall GraphEm: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip uninstall graphem\sphinxhyphen{}jax \&\& pip install graphem\sphinxhyphen{}jax}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check that all dependencies are compatible versions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Try installing in a fresh virtual environment

\end{enumerate}


\section{Getting Help}
\label{\detokenize{installation:getting-help}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If you encounter installation issues:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check our \sphinxhref{https://github.com/sashakolpakov/graphem/issues}{GitHub Issues}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a new issue with your system details and error messages

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Quick Start Guide}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:quick-start-guide}}\label{\detokenize{quickstart::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide will get you up and running with GraphEm in just a few minutes.


\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install GraphEm using pip:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }graphem\PYGZhy{}jax
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For GPU/TPU acceleration (optional but recommended for large graphs), see the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/google/jax\#installation}{JAX installation guide}.


\section{Your First Graph Embedding}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:your-first-graph-embedding}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Let’s start with a simple example of embedding a random graph:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{graphem}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{ge}
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{numpy}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{np}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generate a random graph}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{erdos\PYGZus{}renyi\PYGZus{}graph}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{200}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.05}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Create an embedder}
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{200}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{dimension}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 3D embedding}
    \PYG{n}{L\PYGZus{}min}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{10.0}\PYG{p}{,}       \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Minimum edge length}
    \PYG{n}{k\PYGZus{}attr}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.5}\PYG{p}{,}       \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Attraction force}
    \PYG{n}{k\PYGZus{}inter}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{,}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Repulsion force}
    \PYG{n}{knn\PYGZus{}k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{15}          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Nearest neighbors}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Compute the embedding}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{40}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Visualize the result}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{display\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edge\PYGZus{}width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.5}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{node\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Understanding the Parameters}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:understanding-the-parameters}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{dimension}: Embedding space dimension (2D or 3D)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{L\_min}: Controls minimum distance between connected nodes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{k\_attr}: Strength of attractive forces between connected nodes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{k\_inter}: Strength of repulsive forces between all nodes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{knn\_k}: Number of nearest neighbors for efficient force computation

\end{itemize}


\section{Graph Generation}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:graph-generation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm provides various graph generators:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Scale\PYGZhy{}free network (Barabási\textendash{}Albert)}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ba}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Small\PYGZhy{}world network (Watts\textendash{}Strogatz)}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ws}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Stochastic block model}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}sbm}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}per\PYGZus{}block}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}blocks}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p\PYGZus{}in}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p\PYGZus{}out}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.01}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Random regular graph}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}random\PYGZus{}regular}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{300}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{d}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Working with Real Data}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:working-with-real-data}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load and analyze real\sphinxhyphen{}world networks:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Load a dataset (includes several network datasets)}
\PYG{n}{vertices}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}dataset}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{snap\PYGZhy{}ca\PYGZhy{}GrQc}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Collaboration network}
\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{vertices}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Create embedder for larger networks}
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{dimension}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{knn\PYGZus{}k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{p}{,}           \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} More neighbors for denser graphs}
    \PYG{n}{sample\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{512}\PYG{p}{,}    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Larger sample for accuracy}
    \PYG{n}{batch\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2048}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Larger batches for efficiency}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{display\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Influence Maximization}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:influence-maximization}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Find the most influential nodes in a network:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{networkx}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{nx}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Convert to NetworkX for influence analysis}
\PYG{n}{G} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nx}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Graph}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{G}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add\PYGZus{}nodes\PYGZus{}from}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{G}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add\PYGZus{}edges\PYGZus{}from}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Method 1: GraphEm\PYGZhy{}based selection (uses embedding)}
\PYG{n}{seeds\PYGZus{}graphem} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{graphem\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}selection}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Method 2: Greedy selection (traditional approach)}
\PYG{n}{seeds\PYGZus{}greedy} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{greedy\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}selection}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{G}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Estimate influence spread}
\PYG{n}{influence}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{iterations} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ndlib\PYGZus{}estimated\PYGZus{}influence}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{G}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{seeds\PYGZus{}graphem}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{iterations\PYGZus{}count}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{200}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{GraphEm method: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{influence}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ nodes influenced (}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{influence}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{l+s+si}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{.2\PYGZpc{}}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Benchmarking and Analysis}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:benchmarking-and-analysis}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compare different centrality measures:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{graphem}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{benchmark}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{benchmark\PYGZus{}correlations}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{graphem}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{visualization}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{report\PYGZus{}full\PYGZus{}correlation\PYGZus{}matrix}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run comprehensive benchmark}
\PYG{n}{results} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{benchmark\PYGZus{}correlations}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{graph\PYGZus{}generator}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ba}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{graph\PYGZus{}params}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{300}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{m}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{dim}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{50}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Display correlation matrix}

    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{radii}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}           \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Embedding\PYGZhy{}based centrality}
    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{degree}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Degree centrality}
    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{betweenness}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Betweenness centrality}
    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{eigenvector}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Eigenvector centrality}
    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{pagerank}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} PageRank}
    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{closeness}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}       \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Closeness centrality}
    \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{node\PYGZus{}load}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Load centrality}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Performance Tips}
\label{\detokenize{quickstart:performance-tips}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{For Large Graphs (\textgreater{}10k nodes):}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{dimension}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}           \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 2D is faster than 3D}
    \PYG{n}{knn\PYGZus{}k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,}             \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Fewer neighbors = faster}
    \PYG{n}{sample\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{256}\PYG{p}{,}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Smaller samples = faster}
    \PYG{n}{batch\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4096}\PYG{p}{,}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Larger batches = more efficient}
    \PYG{n}{verbose}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}         \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Disable progress bars}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{GPU Acceleration:}

\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm automatically uses GPU if JAX detects CUDA:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{jax}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Available devices:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{jax}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{devices}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Check for GPU}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Force CPU usage if needed}
\PYG{k}{with} \PYG{n}{jax}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{default\PYGZus{}device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{jax}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{devices}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{cpu}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{50}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Memory Management:}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For very large graphs, process in chunks:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} For graphs with \PYGZgt{}100k nodes, consider reducing parameters}
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{knn\PYGZus{}k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{,}              \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Minimum viable k}
    \PYG{n}{sample\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{128}\PYG{p}{,}      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Smaller sample}
    \PYG{n}{batch\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1024}       \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Smaller batches}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Graph Embedding Deep Dive}
\label{\detokenize{tutorials:graph-embedding-deep-dive}}

\subsection{Understanding GraphEm’s Embedding Algorithm}
\label{\detokenize{tutorials:understanding-graphem-s-embedding-algorithm}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm combines spectral methods with force\sphinxhyphen{}directed layout for high\sphinxhyphen{}quality embeddings:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{graphem}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{ge}
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{numpy}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{np}
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{matplotlib}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{pyplot}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{plt}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Create a graph with known structure}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}sbm}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}per\PYGZus{}block}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{50}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}blocks}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p\PYGZus{}in}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.15}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p\PYGZus{}out}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.02}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{150}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Create embedder with detailed parameters}
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{dimension}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{L\PYGZus{}min}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{5.0}\PYG{p}{,}        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Shorter edges for tighter layout}
    \PYG{n}{k\PYGZus{}attr}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.8}\PYG{p}{,}       \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Strong attraction within communities}
    \PYG{n}{k\PYGZus{}inter}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.05}\PYG{p}{,}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Weak repulsion between communities}
    \PYG{n}{knn\PYGZus{}k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} More neighbors for better structure}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Monitor convergence}
\PYG{n}{positions\PYGZus{}history} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{positions\PYGZus{}history}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{array}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{positions}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Final visualization}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{display\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Parameter Tuning Guide}
\label{\detokenize{tutorials:parameter-tuning-guide}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

    \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{L\PYGZus{}min}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{10.0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{k\PYGZus{}attr}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.8}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{k\PYGZus{}inter}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.5}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{title}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Tight Layout}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{fig} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{make\PYGZus{}subplots}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{rows}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{cols}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}
                    \PYG{n}{subplot\PYGZus{}titles}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{p}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{title}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{p} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{params\PYGZus{}to\PYGZus{}test}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
                    \PYG{n}{specs}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{type}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{scatter}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{type}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{scatter}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{type}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{scatter}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{params} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{enumerate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{params\PYGZus{}to\PYGZus{}test}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
        \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{dimension}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{n}{L\PYGZus{}min}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{params}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{L\PYGZus{}min}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k\PYGZus{}attr}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{params}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{k\PYGZus{}attr}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k\PYGZus{}inter}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{params}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{k\PYGZus{}inter}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}
    \PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{pos} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{array}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{positions}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{fig}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add\PYGZus{}trace}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{go}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Scatter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{pos}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{pos}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{mode}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{markers}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                            \PYG{n}{name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{params}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{title}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{row}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{col}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{)}

\section{Working with Large Networks}
\label{\detokenize{tutorials:working-with-large-networks}}

\subsection{Handling Networks with 10k+ Nodes}
\label{\detokenize{tutorials:handling-networks-with-10k-nodes}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
For large networks, optimize performance and memory usage:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generate a large scale\PYGZhy{}free network}
\PYG{n}{large\PYGZus{}edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ba}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10000}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Optimized embedder for large graphs}

\subsection{Memory\sphinxhyphen{}Efficient Processing}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For extremely large networks, use chunked processing:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{embed\PYGZus{}large\PYGZus{}network\PYGZus{}chunked}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{chunk\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5000}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Embed very large networks in chunks.\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{chunk\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Small enough to process normally}
        \PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{50}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{positions}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} For very large networks, use progressive approach}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Processing }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ nodes in chunks of }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{chunk\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Start with a subgraph}
    \PYG{n}{node\PYGZus{}subset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{random}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{choice}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{chunk\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{replace}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{mask} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isin}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{node\PYGZus{}subset}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZam{}} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isin}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{node\PYGZus{}subset}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{subset\PYGZus{}edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{mask}\PYG{p}{]}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Remap node IDs to 0\PYGZhy{}based consecutive}
    \PYG{n}{old\PYGZus{}to\PYGZus{}new} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{old}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{new} \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{new}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{old} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{enumerate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{node\PYGZus{}subset}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
    \PYG{n}{remapped\PYGZus{}edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{array}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{old\PYGZus{}to\PYGZus{}new}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{old\PYGZus{}to\PYGZus{}new}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{e}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}
                              \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{e} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{subset\PYGZus{}edges}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Embed subset}
    \PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{remapped\PYGZus{}edges}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{node\PYGZus{}subset}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This is a simplified example \PYGZhy{} full implementation would}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} gradually add nodes and refine positions}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{positions}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Time embedding}
    \PYG{n}{start\PYGZus{}time} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{time}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{time}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{iterations}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{end\PYGZus{}time} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{time}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{time}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Memory after}
    \PYG{n}{mem\PYGZus{}after} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{process}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{memory\PYGZus{}info}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rss} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1024} \PYG{o}{/} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1024}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} MB}

    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
        \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{time}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{end\PYGZus{}time} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{start\PYGZus{}time}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{memory\PYGZus{}used}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{mem\PYGZus{}after} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{n}{mem\PYGZus{}before}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{final\PYGZus{}memory}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{mem\PYGZus{}after}
    \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Test different graph sizes}

\item {}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

and return the estimated final influence (number of nodes in state 2) and
the number of iterations executed.

\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{iterations\_count}} \textendash{} int
Maximum number of simulation iterations

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{float}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The estimated influence (average number of influenced nodes)

\sphinxlineitem{iterations: int}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The number of iterations run

\end{description}


\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
influence

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{greedy\_seed\_selection() (in module graphem.influence)@\spxentry{greedy\_seed\_selection()}\spxextra{in module graphem.influence}}

\section{Dataset Utilities}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:module-graphem.datasets}}\label{\detokenize{api_reference:dataset-utilities}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!graphem.datasets@\spxentry{graphem.datasets}}\index{graphem.datasets@\spxentry{graphem.datasets}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Real\sphinxhyphen{}world dataset loader for Graphem.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides functions to download and load standard large graph datasets
from various sources including SNAP (Stanford Network Analysis Project),
Network Repository, and other public graph repositories.

\index{SNAPDataset (class in graphem.datasets)@\spxentry{SNAPDataset}\spxextra{class in graphem.datasets}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar

SNAP datasets are commonly used in network analysis research.
Source: \sphinxurl{https://snap.stanford.edu/data/}

\subsection{graphem.generators module}
\label{\detokenize{api_reference:module-0}}\label{\detokenize{api_reference:graphem-generators-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!graphem.generators@\spxentry{graphem.generators}}\index{graphem.generators@\spxentry{graphem.generators}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Graph generators for Graphem.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides various functions to generate different types of graphs.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{float}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The estimated influence (average number of influenced nodes)

\sphinxlineitem{iterations: int}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The number of iterations run

\end{description}

\chapter{Contributing to GraphEm}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:contributing-to-graphem}}\label{\detokenize{contributing::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
We welcome contributions to GraphEm! This guide will help you get started with development, testing, and submitting high\sphinxhyphen{}quality contributions.


\section{Development Environment Setup}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:development-environment-setup}}

\subsection{Prerequisites}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:prerequisites}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Before contributing, ensure you have:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Python 3.8+ (Python 3.9+ recommended)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Git

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
A virtual environment manager (venv, conda, or similar)

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Initial Setup}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:initial-setup}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Fork and clone the repository:}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/YOUR\PYGZus{}USERNAME/graphem.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }graphem
git\PYG{+w}{ }remote\PYG{+w}{ }add\PYG{+w}{ }upstream\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/sashakolpakov/graphem.git
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{1}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Create and activate a virtual environment:}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}m\PYG{+w}{ }venv\PYG{+w}{ }graphem\PYGZhy{}dev
\PYG{n+nb}{source}\PYG{+w}{ }graphem\PYGZhy{}dev/bin/activate\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} On Windows: graphem\PYGZhy{}dev\PYGZbs{}Scripts\PYGZbs{}activate}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{2}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Install in development mode:}

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}upgrade\PYG{+w}{ }pip
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}e\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}.[docs]\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{+w}{  }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Install documentation}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Testing Your Installation}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:testing-your-installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify your setup works correctly:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run basic tests}
python\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}c\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}import graphem as ge; print(\PYGZsq{}Import successful\PYGZsq{})\PYGZdq{}}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run example scripts}
python\PYG{+w}{ }examples/graph\PYGZus{}generator\PYGZus{}test.py
python\PYG{+w}{ }examples/real\PYGZus{}world\PYGZus{}datasets\PYGZus{}test.py

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run benchmarks (takes a few minutes)}
python\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYGZus{}benchmarks.py
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Code Style and Quality}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:code-style-and-quality}}

\subsection{Coding Standards}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:coding-standards}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm follows these coding standards:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{PEP 8} for Python style

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Type hints} for all public functions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{NumPy\sphinxhyphen{}style docstrings} for documentation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{JAX best practices} for numerical computation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Consistent naming}: snake\_case for functions, PascalCase for classes

\end{itemize}


\section{Documentation Guidelines}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:documentation-guidelines}}

\subsection{Writing Documentation}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:writing-documentation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All public functions must have comprehensive docstrings:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nf}{complex\PYGZus{}function}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{param1}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{param2}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{optional\PYGZus{}param}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{float} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{Tuple}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ndarray}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Dict}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Any}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    One\PYGZhy{}line summary of the function.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Longer description explaining what the function does, when to use it,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    and any important details about the implementation or algorithm.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Parameters}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    param1 : int}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Description of the first parameter.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    param2 : str}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Description of the second parameter.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    optional\PYGZus{}param : float, optional}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Description of optional parameter, by default 1.0.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Returns}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Tuple[np.ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Description of return values:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZhy{} First element: array description}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZhy{} Second element: dictionary description}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Raises}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    ValueError}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        When parameter validation fails.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    RuntimeError}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        When computation fails.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Examples}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} result\PYGZus{}array, result\PYGZus{}dict = complex\PYGZus{}function(10, \PYGZdq{}test\PYGZdq{})}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} print(result\PYGZus{}array.shape)}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    (10, 2)}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Notes}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    Any additional notes about the algorithm, complexity, or usage.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    References}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    .. [1] Author, \PYGZdq{}Paper Title\PYGZdq{}, Journal, Year.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{Adding Examples}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:adding-examples}}

When adding examples:
\begin{enumerate}

\sphinxstylestrong{Create complete, runnable scripts} in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{examples/}}

\subsection{PR Guidelines}
\label{\detokenize{contributing:pr-guidelines}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Clear title} describing the change

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Detailed description} explaining:
\sphinxhyphen{} What the change does
\sphinxhyphen{} Why it’s needed
\sphinxhyphen{} How it works
\sphinxhyphen{} Any breaking changes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Link issues} if applicable

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Include tests} for new functionality

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Update documentation} for user\sphinxhyphen{}facing changes

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Example PR template:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gu}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{} Summary}
Brief description of what this PR does.

\PYG{g+gu}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{} Changes}
\PYG{k}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{+w}{ }Add new graph generator for hierarchical networks
\PYG{k}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{+w}{ }Update documentation with examples
\PYG{k}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{+w}{ }Add comprehensive tests

\PYG{g+gu}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{} Testing}
\PYG{k}{\PYGZhy{} }\PYG{k}{[ ]} Benchmarks run successfully
\PYG{k}{\PYGZhy{} }\PYG{k}{[ ]} Documentation builds without errors

\PYG{g+gu}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{} Breaking Changes}
None / List any breaking changes
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{What is GraphEm?}
\label{\detokenize{index:what-is-graphem}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm is a comprehensive Python library that combines cutting\sphinxhyphen{}edge graph embedding techniques with influence maximization algorithms. Built on JAX for high\sphinxhyphen{}performance computation, it enables researchers and practitioners to analyze large\sphinxhyphen{}scale networks efficiently.


\section{Key Features}
\label{\detokenize{index:key-features}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{High\sphinxhyphen{}Performance Computing}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
JAX\sphinxhyphen{}accelerated computations with GPU/TPU support

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
JIT compilation for optimized performance

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Memory\sphinxhyphen{}efficient algorithms for large networks

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Batch processing capabilities

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Advanced Graph Embedding}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Spectral initialization using graph Laplacian

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Force\sphinxhyphen{}directed layout refinement with customizable forces

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
2D and 3D embedding support

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Hierarchical position indexing for efficient k\sphinxhyphen{}NN search

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Influence Maximization}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Novel embedding\sphinxhyphen{}based seed selection algorithm

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Traditional greedy algorithm for comparison

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
NDlib integration for influence spread simulation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Comprehensive benchmarking tools

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Graph Generation \& Datasets}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
12+ standard graph models (Erdős\textendash{}Rényi, Barabási\textendash{}Albert, Watts\textendash{}Strogatz, etc.)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Built\sphinxhyphen{}in loaders for real\sphinxhyphen{}world datasets (SNAP, Network Repository)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Custom graph generators for domain\sphinxhyphen{}specific networks

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Visualization \& Analysis}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Interactive 2D/3D plots with Plotly

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Centrality correlation analysis

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Performance benchmarking tools

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Comprehensive reporting utilities

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\section{Quick Start Example}
\label{\detokenize{index:quick-start-example}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{graphem}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{ge}
\PYG{k+kn}{import}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{networkx}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k}{as}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{nx}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generate a scale\PYGZhy{}free network}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ba}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Create and run embedding}
\PYG{n}{embedder} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{GraphEmbedder}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{n\PYGZus{}vertices}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1000}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{dimension}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}
\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}iterations}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{50}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Find influential nodes}
\PYG{n}{seeds} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{graphem\PYGZus{}seed\PYGZus{}selection}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Estimate influence spread}
\PYG{n}{G} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nx}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Graph}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{edges}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{influence}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ndlib\PYGZus{}estimated\PYGZus{}influence}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{G}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{seeds}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{f}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Influence spread: }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{influence}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ nodes (}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{n}{influence}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1000}\PYG{l+s+si}{:}\PYG{l+s+s2}{.1\PYGZpc{}}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Visualize results}
\PYG{n}{embedder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{display\PYGZus{}layout}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{index:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Install GraphEm using pip:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }graphem\PYGZhy{}jax
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For GPU/TPU support, see the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/google/jax\#installation}{JAX installation guide}.


\chapter{Core Components}
\label{\detokenize{index:core-components}}

\section{GraphEmbedder}
\label{\detokenize{index:graphembedder}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The main embedding engine that combines spectral initialization with iterative force\sphinxhyphen{}directed refinement:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Spectral Initialization}: Uses graph Laplacian eigenvectors for initial positioning

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Force\sphinxhyphen{}Directed Layout}: Applies spring forces between connected nodes and repulsion between all nodes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Intersection Avoidance}: Prevents node overlap for cleaner visualizations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Adaptive Parameters}: Automatically adjusts forces based on graph structure

\end{itemize}


\section{HPIndex}
\label{\detokenize{index:hpindex}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
High performance index for efficient k\sphinxhyphen{}nearest neighbor search in high\sphinxhyphen{}dimensional embeddings:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Memory Efficient}: Memory tiling for large point sets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Batch Processing}: Vectorized nearest neighbor queries

\end{itemize}


\section{Influence Maximization}
\label{\detokenize{index:influence-maximization}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Advanced algorithms for identifying influential nodes in networks:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{GraphEm Method}: Uses embedding radial distances to select diverse, influential seeds

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Greedy Baseline}: Traditional greedy algorithm for comparison

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Spread Simulation}: NDlib integration for accurate influence estimation

\end{itemize}


\section{Graph Generators}
\label{\detokenize{index:graph-generators}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Comprehensive collection of standard and custom graph models:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Classic models}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{erdos\PYGZus{}renyi\PYGZus{}graph}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.02}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ba}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Scale\PYGZhy{}free}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}ws}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{k}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Small\PYGZhy{}world}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Community structures}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}sbm}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{sizes}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{150}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p\PYGZus{}in}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{p\PYGZus{}out}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.01}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}caveman}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{clique\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}cliques}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Specialized networks}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}geometric}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{300}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{radius}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{edges} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ge}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{generate\PYGZus{}road\PYGZus{}network}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{grid\PYGZus{}size}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{connection\PYGZus{}prob}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.8}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Performance Characteristics}
\label{\detokenize{index:performance-characteristics}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm is designed for high performance across different scales:
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Small Networks (\textless{} 1K nodes)}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Real\sphinxhyphen{}time embedding and visualization

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Interactive parameter tuning

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Comprehensive analysis possible

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Medium Networks (1K \sphinxhyphen{} 10K nodes)}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Efficient embedding with optimized parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Batch processing for multiple analyses

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
GPU acceleration recommended

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{\sphinxstylestrong{Large Networks (10K+ nodes)}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Memory\sphinxhyphen{}efficient algorithms

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Progressive refinement strategies

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Distributed processing capabilities

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\section{Benchmarking Results}
\label{\detokenize{index:benchmarking-results}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
GraphEm shows promising performance:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Speed}: Much faster than the greedy algorithm for node influence maximization

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Memory}: Memory tiling for efficiency, can process large datasets

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Accuracy}: Strong correlation with ground\sphinxhyphen{}truth centrality measures

\end{itemize}
